title: How to Make Feijoa Jam

steps.headline: Boil feijoa skins.
steps.description: Use enough water to just cover.

steps.headline: Strain and remove the skins from the liquid.
Pour half cup of liquid.
steps.description: Top up with boiling water if needed.

steps.headline: Pour the liquid into a heavy based saucepan and add sliced feijoas.
Cook over low heat until tender.
Add sugar and boil quickly until the setting point is reached.
Leave jam to settle off the heat for 15 minutes once the setting point is reached.
steps.description: This is to prevent the fruit rising to the surface when poured into the jars.

steps.headline: Pour into a sterilized jam container.

text: Boil feijoa skins. Use enough water to just cover. Strain and remove the skins from the liquid.  Pour half cup of liquid. Top up with boiling water if needed. Pour the liquid into a heavy based saucepan and add sliced feijoas.  Cook over low heat until tender.  Add sugar and boil quickly until the setting point is reached.  Leave jam to settle off the heat for 15 minutes once the setting point is reached. This is to prevent the fruit rising to the surface when poured into the jars. Pour into a sterilized jam container.  Finished.
